title: GatorRenter
description: Zillow-like real-estate rental website group project for Software Engineering term project at SFSU. I worked as a front-end developer and designed some features such as site logo, district view, messaging template, and various user forms using bootstrap, HTML, and CSS.
skills: HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Node.js, Express, MySQL

title: 6CardsGolf
description: A real-time multiplayer web version of 6 cards golf card game. I programmed the backend in node.js, organize MongoDB for storage, manage socket.io for player turns, connection, disconnection, design client interface using React.js, and develop various card themes using photoshop.

title: REST API
description: REST API for districts feature of the GatorRenter software engineering project. This API will return all the popular housing districts in San Francisco when generating a /districts GET resquest, filter out the geographical location by calling /districts/{portion} GET request, and accept query parameter 'lte' to find SF districts that has a distance (in miles) less than or equal to the parameter away from SFSU campus.

title: BlueSky Weather App
description: Simple weather app and forum that follows an MVC (Model-View-Controller) web design pattern. This web app uses weatherbit.io API for forecast fetching through Axios and weather logo rendering. GridFS was use to store image on MongoDB.

title: 2D Tank Game
description: A 2-players 2D tank game for Software Development term project 1 written in Java. Each tanks have 3 lives and can shoot infinitely and the game is over when one player has a life of 0. A tank can shoot through a specific type of wall and can be healed by a medkit powerup.

title: Brick Breaker Game
description: A mixture of brick breaker and rainbow reef game written in Java. This is the final term project for Software Development. This game features a basketball and other types of objects/powerups that help the ball break through tiles to destroy a specific target.

title: Interpreter
description: This program is a mock interpreter of the fake language 'X' using Java for Software Development course assignment. The interpreter is basically a compiler for a made-up ByteCode which has functionality to run an '.x.cod' file extension. Arraylists and Hashmaps are used throughout this project.

title: Mock Linux Shell
description: This program remakes the Linux shell command line using C for Operating Systems course. It is the basic functionality of the Linux shell that accepts Linux command (ls, cd, etc) just like the Linux terminal. Forking, piping, and system calls such as execvp() are being used throughout this project.

title: Calculator GUI
description: This program is an implementation of a calculator that follows mathematical order of operations (PEMDAS) of infix operation to function the Graphical User Interface. This program uses Java ArrayLists and Stack data structures to evaluate the operation.
